title: The Chinese Embassy in Bulgaria Donates 230 Pieces of Martial Arts Equipment to the Bulgarian Martial Arts Federation
description: On 30 January 2017, the Chinese Embassy in Bulgaria donated 230 pieces of martial arts equipment to the Bulgarian Martial Arts Federation. The Martial Arts equipment included knives and sticks. Donation ceremony was held in the Bulgarian Youth and Sports Summer Conference Hall.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
The Chinese Embassy in Bulgaria Donates 230 Pieces of Martial Arts Equipment to the Bulgarian Martial Arts Federation

# Description
On 30 January 2017, the Chinese Embassy in Bulgaria donated 230 pieces of martial arts equipment to the Bulgarian Martial Arts Federation. The Martial Arts equipment included knives and sticks. Donation ceremony was held in the Bulgarian Youth and Sports Summer Conference Hall.
justification: Project is a donation of sports equipment unrelated to energy or environmental impacts
evidence: Donation of martial arts equipment, no energy or environmental components mentioned

title: The Chinese Embassy in Bulgaria Donated 300 Books to the Bulgarian National Library
description: On 19 September 2007, the Chinese Embassy in Bulgaria donated 300 books to the Bulgarian National Library. Chinese Ambassador to Bulgaria Yu Zhenqi and Embassy Cultural Counselor Wu Guang attended the donation ceremony. In his speech, Ambassador Yu Zhenqi pointed out that the Chinese Ministry of Culture and the State Council Information Office strongly supported the book donation. The goal of the gift from the perspective of China is to help the Bulgarian people understand China and further deepen the friendship between the two countries.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
The Chinese Embassy in Bulgaria Donated 300 Books to the Bulgarian National Library

# Description
On 19 September 2007, the Chinese Embassy in Bulgaria donated 300 books to the Bulgarian National Library. Chinese Ambassador to Bulgaria Yu Zhenqi and Embassy Cultural Counselor Wu Guang attended the donation ceremony. In his speech, Ambassador Yu Zhenqi pointed out that the Chinese Ministry of Culture and the State Council Information Office strongly supported the book donation. The goal of the gift from the perspective of China is to help the Bulgarian people understand China and further deepen the friendship between the two countries.
justification: Project is a cultural exchange initiative with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Book donation to national library, cultural exchange focus, no energy or infrastructure components

title: Hanban donates classroom materials and sponsors Chinese language instruction at the Ruse Middle School
description: In 2007, with the support of the Chinese Embassy in Bulgaria, ​​Ruse Middle School construction on a Chinese language Classroom. A listening equipment room, a traditional classroom, and a student study room make up the new Chinese Language Classroom, which is valued at RMB 500,000 RMB. On January 21, 2010, the Chinese Ambassador to Bulgaria, Zhang Wanxe, and the Head of the Education Department, Zeng Xianhong, visited Ruse, Bulgaria, for the ribbon-cutting ceremony and books donation ceremony for the Chinese language classroom of Ruse Middle School. Hanban sponsored the donations. The 1400 books that were donated were valued at RMB 100,000.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
Hanban donates classroom materials and sponsors Chinese language instruction at the Ruse Middle School

# Description
In 2007, with the support of the Chinese Embassy in Bulgaria, ​​Ruse Middle School construction on a Chinese language Classroom. A listening equipment room, a traditional classroom, and a student study room make up the new Chinese Language Classroom, which is valued at RMB 500,000 RMB. On January 21, 2010, the Chinese Ambassador to Bulgaria, Zhang Wanxe, and the Head of the Education Department, Zeng Xianhong, visited Ruse, Bulgaria, for the ribbon-cutting ceremony and books donation ceremony for the Chinese language classroom of Ruse Middle School. Hanban sponsored the donations. The 1400 books that were donated were valued at RMB 100,000.
justification: Project focuses on education and cultural exchange without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Classroom construction, language instruction, and book donations for educational purposes

title: Chinese Government cancels RMB 213 million of the Government of Burundi’s outstanding debt obligations
description: On May 25, 2007, the Chinese Government and the Government of Burundi signed an agreement on the remission of the Government of Burundi’s outstanding debt obligations to the Chinese Government.  This debt forgiveness agreement reportedly eliminated all of the Government of Burundi’s outstanding debt obligations. The debts that were forgiven resulted from interest-free Chinese Government loans that the Government of Burundi previously contracted.
staff_comments: The IMF and SAIS-CARI record the amount of debt forgiveness that was provided as $13.7 million and $15 million, respectively. However, since the Chinese Government forgave the Government of Burundi’s outstanding debt obligations resulting from interest-free loans that it previously contracted, and interest-free loans from the Chinese Government are almost always denominated in RMB, AidData treats RMB 213 million as the value of the debt that was forgiven.China made a concerted effort in 2007 to forgive the debt from interest-free loans maturing by the end of 2005 to heavily-indebted African countries (http://kp.china-embassy.org/chn//zgxw/zgzxxw/t293317.htm). Since interest-free loans usually have 20 year maturities (http://www.gov.cn/zwgk/2011-04/21/content_1850553.htm), we have assumed the loans included in this debt forgiveness package would have been contracted before 2000. As such, this project is not marked as umbrella, as there is little risk of double counting.
combined_text:
# Sector
ACTION RELATING TO DEBT

# Title
Chinese Government cancels RMB 213 million of the Government of Burundi’s outstanding debt obligations

# Description
On May 25, 2007, the Chinese Government and the Government of Burundi signed an agreement on the remission of the Government of Burundi’s outstanding debt obligations to the Chinese Government.  This debt forgiveness agreement reportedly eliminated all of the Government of Burundi’s outstanding debt obligations. The debts that were forgiven resulted from interest-free Chinese Government loans that the Government of Burundi previously contracted.
justification: Debt forgiveness agreement with no direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Debt remission agreement, no specific project or environmental component mentioned

title: Chinese Government provides $439,811 grant for establishment of China-Burundi Malaria Control Center
description: At the Beijing Summit of the Forum on China-Africa Cooperation (FOCAC) in November 2006, the Chinese Government pledged to construct a malaria prevention and treatment center in Burundi. Then, on October 12, 2007, China's Ambassador to Burundi signed an exchange of letters on the establishment of a China-Burundi Malaria Control Center.   The opening ceremony for the Center was held on March 27, 2008. The China-Burundi Malaria Control Center is located at the Institut National de Santé Publique (INSP) in Bujumbura. At least 5 Chinese experts were deployed to support the work of the Center. According to the Government of Burundi's Development Assistance Database (DAD), the Chinese Government disbursed $439,811 of grant funding in support of this project.
staff_comments: - The Chinese project title is 布隆迪抗疟防治中心. - The French project title is Mise en place d'un centre de prévention et de traitement du paludisme.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese Government provides $439,811 grant for establishment of China-Burundi Malaria Control Center

# Description
At the Beijing Summit of the Forum on China-Africa Cooperation (FOCAC) in November 2006, the Chinese Government pledged to construct a malaria prevention and treatment center in Burundi. Then, on October 12, 2007, China's Ambassador to Burundi signed an exchange of letters on the establishment of a China-Burundi Malaria Control Center.   The opening ceremony for the Center was held on March 27, 2008. The China-Burundi Malaria Control Center is located at the Institut National de Santé Publique (INSP) in Bujumbura. At least 5 Chinese experts were deployed to support the work of the Center. According to the Government of Burundi's Development Assistance Database (DAD), the Chinese Government disbursed $439,811 of grant funding in support of this project.
justification: Project is focused on healthcare infrastructure and disease prevention, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Malaria control center, healthcare focus, grant funding for public health

title: Chinese Government provides RMB 30 million grant for the Fourth Phase of the 8MW Mugere Hydroelectric Power Plant Rehabilitation Project
description: In September 2007, the Chinese Government agreed to provide an RMB 30 million grant to the Government of Burundi for the Fourth Phase of the 8MW Mugere Hydroelectric Power Plant Rehabilitation Project. The 8MW Mugere Hydroelectric Power Plant is located in Kabezi commune within rural Bujumbura province along the Mugere River. Its construction was originally financed by the Chinese Government during the late 1970s and early 1980s.   The Chinese Government subsequently funded the First Phase of the 8MW Mugere Hydroelectric Power Plant Rehabilitation Project in 1987, the Second Phase of the 8MW Mugere Hydroelectric Power Plant Rehabilitation Project in 1993, and the Third Phase of the 8MW Mugere Hydroelectric Power Plant Rehabilitation Project in 2000.   Hebei Hydraulic Engineering Bureau (河北省水利工程局), China First Highway Engineering Company (CFHEC), and China Road and Bridge Corporation were the contractors responsible for implementation of the fourth phase of the power plant rehabilitation project.   Construction began in April 2009 and the project was officially completed and handed over to the authorities on November 15, 2010. At the time, the Mugere Hydroelectric Power Plant provided nearly 30% of the electricity consumption of Bujumbura, the Burundian capital, and 40% of the hydroelectricity produced by Regideso (Burundi's state-owned company responsible for the the production and distribution of water).
staff_comments: - This project is also known simply as the 8MW Mugere Hydroelectric Power Plant Rehabilitation Project. - The Chinese project title is 穆杰雷水电站维修项目 or 援建的穆杰雷水电站. - The French project title is la réhabilitation de la centrale hydroélectrique de Mugere (8 MW) or Barrage de Mugere.
combined_text:
# Sector
ENERGY

# Title
Chinese Government provides RMB 30 million grant for the Fourth Phase of the 8MW Mugere Hydroelectric Power Plant Rehabilitation Project

# Description
In September 2007, the Chinese Government agreed to provide an RMB 30 million grant to the Government of Burundi for the Fourth Phase of the 8MW Mugere Hydroelectric Power Plant Rehabilitation Project. The 8MW Mugere Hydroelectric Power Plant is located in Kabezi commune within rural Bujumbura province along the Mugere River. Its construction was originally financed by the Chinese Government during the late 1970s and early 1980s.   The Chinese Government subsequently funded the First Phase of the 8MW Mugere Hydroelectric Power Plant Rehabilitation Project in 1987, the Second Phase of the 8MW Mugere Hydroelectric Power Plant Rehabilitation Project in 1993, and the Third Phase of the 8MW Mugere Hydroelectric Power Plant Rehabilitation Project in 2000.   Hebei Hydraulic Engineering Bureau (河北省水利工程局), China First Highway Engineering Company (CFHEC), and China Road and Bridge Corporation were the contractors responsible for implementation of the fourth phase of the power plant rehabilitation project.   Construction began in April 2009 and the project was officially completed and handed over to the authorities on November 15, 2010. At the time, the Mugere Hydroelectric Power Plant provided nearly 30% of the electricity consumption of Bujumbura, the Burundian capital, and 40% of the hydroelectricity produced by Regideso (Burundi's state-owned company responsible for the the production and distribution of water).
justification: Primary purpose is rehabilitation of a hydroelectric power plant, a renewable energy source
evidence: 8MW Mugere Hydroelectric Power Plant, hydroelectricity production, significant contribution to regional electricity supply

title: Chinese Government provides RMB 1 million grant for first batch of anti-malarial drugs
description: On August 1 and 24, 2006, the Chinese Government and the Government of Burundi signed letters of exchange for the donation of a batch of anti-malarial drugs. The monetary value of this grant commitment was RMB 1 million. The drugs were successfully delivered on April 24, 2007.
staff_comments: The French project title is Projet de fourniture des médicaments. The Chinese project title is 供抗疟药品项目.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese Government provides RMB 1 million grant for first batch of anti-malarial drugs

# Description
On August 1 and 24, 2006, the Chinese Government and the Government of Burundi signed letters of exchange for the donation of a batch of anti-malarial drugs. The monetary value of this grant commitment was RMB 1 million. The drugs were successfully delivered on April 24, 2007.
justification: Project is focused on healthcare provision with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Anti-malarial drug donation, healthcare sector focus

title: Chinese Government provides RMB 10 million grant to support the Government of Burundi’s Strategic Framework for the Fight Against Poverty
description: In 2007, the Burundian President received an RMB 10 million grant from the Chinese Government to support the Government of Burundi’s implementation of its Strategic Framework for the Fight Against Poverty. The goal of this framework is to reduce poverty in both urban and rural areas while also focusing on restoring social security and the national economy. The proceeds from this grant were used to obtain construction and transportation materials for use in Bujumbura. These materials were delivered in two batches: one on June 20, 2007 and one on August 14, 2007.
staff_comments: The Chinese project title is 援助布隆迪建材和交通工具等物资交.
combined_text:
# Sector
GOVERNMENT AND CIVIL SOCIETY

# Title
Chinese Government provides RMB 10 million grant to support the Government of Burundi’s Strategic Framework for the Fight Against Poverty

# Description
In 2007, the Burundian President received an RMB 10 million grant from the Chinese Government to support the Government of Burundi’s implementation of its Strategic Framework for the Fight Against Poverty. The goal of this framework is to reduce poverty in both urban and rural areas while also focusing on restoring social security and the national economy. The proceeds from this grant were used to obtain construction and transportation materials for use in Bujumbura. These materials were delivered in two batches: one on June 20, 2007 and one on August 14, 2007.
justification: Project focuses on poverty reduction and social security without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Grant for poverty reduction framework, construction and transportation materials for social development

title: Chinese Government provides grant for Ministry of Foreign Affairs Office Building Renovation Project
description: On December 11, 2007 and December 18, 2007, the Chinese Government and the Government of Burundi signed a grant agreement and proceeds from the grant were  used primarily for the Ministry of Foreign Affairs Office Building Renovation Project. The project involved the renovation of a large, multi-functional conference room, a small conference room, a reception room, a control room equipped with information technology at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in Burundi. The cost of rehabilitating this room with computer equipment is two million Yuan (about 3.2 thousand US dollars). Hainan Provincial Construction Engineering Company and Huawei Technologies were the contractors responsible for project implemented.   On June 8, 2018, The Ministry of Foreign Affairs inaugurated a refurbished and modernized conference room by the Chinese Ministry of Foreign Relations and Cooperation. The capacity of this room is approximately 180 people. The Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs also allowed the rehabilitation of 3 other small rooms to the Burundian Ministry of Foreign Affairs. This conference room rehabilitated by the Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs is equipped with chairs and a server that can power at least 1000 computers.
staff_comments: The Chinese project title is 布隆迪外交部大楼部分办公室改造工程.
combined_text:
# Sector
GOVERNMENT AND CIVIL SOCIETY

# Title

# Description
On December 11, 2007 and December 18, 2007, the Chinese Government and the Government of Burundi signed a grant agreement and proceeds from the grant were  used primarily for the Ministry of Foreign Affairs Office Building Renovation Project. The project involved the renovation of a large, multi-functional conference room, a small conference room, a reception room, a control room equipped with information technology at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in Burundi. The cost of rehabilitating this room with computer equipment is two million Yuan (about 3.2 thousand US dollars). Hainan Provincial Construction Engineering Company and Huawei Technologies were the contractors responsible for project implemented.   On June 8, 2018, The Ministry of Foreign Affairs inaugurated a refurbished and modernized conference room by the Chinese Ministry of Foreign Relations and Cooperation. The capacity of this room is approximately 180 people. The Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs also allowed the rehabilitation of 3 other small rooms to the Burundian Ministry of Foreign Affairs. This conference room rehabilitated by the Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs is equipped with chairs and a server that can power at least 1000 computers.
justification: Project focuses on government office building renovation and IT equipment installation, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Renovation of conference rooms and IT equipment installation at Ministry of Foreign Affairs office building

title: Chinese Government provides grant for flood relief activities
description: On June 18, 2007, a handover ceremony was held in Bujumbura for a donation from the Chinese Government to the Government Burundi for flood relief activities. The monetary value of this grant agreement is unknown. The proceeds from the grant were earmarked for use by the Government of Burundi’s Ministry of National Stability and Human Rights to help children who became homeless as a result of exposure to natural disasters (i.e. floods) that occurred in 2006 and 2007.
combined_text:
# Sector
EMERGENCY RESPONSE

# Title
Chinese Government provides grant for flood relief activities

# Description
On June 18, 2007, a handover ceremony was held in Bujumbura for a donation from the Chinese Government to the Government Burundi for flood relief activities. The monetary value of this grant agreement is unknown. The proceeds from the grant were earmarked for use by the Government of Burundi’s Ministry of National Stability and Human Rights to help children who became homeless as a result of exposure to natural disasters (i.e. floods) that occurred in 2006 and 2007.
justification: Project is focused on humanitarian aid and disaster relief without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Flood relief activities, assistance for homeless children, humanitarian focus
